meanings.definition: Metal thread or filament used for conducting electricity or transmitting signals.
meanings.sent1: The electrician connected the circuit using a wire.
meanings.sent2: She wrapped the wire around the pole to secure it in place.
meanings.sent3: Why did the wire refuse to conduct electricity? It was feeling a bit 'resistant'.
meanings.sent4: The wire of friendship between them was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The wire hummed with energy as the current flowed through it.

meanings.definition: A piece of thin, flexible metal used for fastening things together.
meanings.sent1: He twisted the wire to hold the papers together.
meanings.sent2: The wire on the fence was rusted but still strong.
meanings.sent3: The wire decided to take up knitting to bond with other wires.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship was like a wire, always keeping things connected.
meanings.sent5: She used the wire to tie a bow around the gift box.

meanings.definition: To send a message or transmit information using telecommunications.
meanings.sent1: They decided to wire the news to their family overseas.
meanings.sent2: He would wire his boss updates on the project's progress.
meanings.sent3: The spy tried to wire a secret message, but it got tangled in transmission.
meanings.sent4: Her smile wired a message of gratitude to everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in his voice wired the news of the victory to all listeners.
